Package edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.manager

Class Project

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.manager.Project
public class Project extends Object
Class stores many user stories in an ArrayList. Projects are stored in an ArrayList inside of RequirementsManager.
Author:
jeff

  • Constructor Details

    • Project

      public Project(String name)
      Constructs an empty project
      Parameters:
      name - to use to title project

  • Method Details

    • setUserStoryId

      public void setUserStoryId()
      Method keeps track of ids of user stories in a project and can be called to find what the ID of the next story created should be. Then sets the ID of the project it is called on.

    • addUserStory

      public int addUserStory(String title, String user, String action, String value)
      Creates a story to add to the project
      Parameters:
      title - Name of the story
      user - Name of the user creating the story
      action - Name of the action the user would like to do
      value - Why the user wants to be able to do the action
      Returns:
      Numerical ID of the project

    • addUserStory

      public void addUserStory(UserStory story)
      Method to add a story if the story has already been created
      Parameters:
      story - to add to the project
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a story with the index provided already exists

    • getUserStories

      public List<UserStory> getUserStories()
      Method returns all user stories contained in the project to RequirementsManager for the UI to be able to display a project
      Returns:
      List of all stories in project

    • getUserStoryById

      public UserStory getUserStoryById(int id)
      Method fetches user story by story ID. Allows GUI user to fetch individual stories. Notably not the index of story in ArrayList, but the ID field associated with it.
      Parameters:
      id - ID to find story of.
      Returns:
      Story that program was searching for

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(int id, Command command)
      Method changes the state of a story from one to another, and is used by manager class to interact with state.
      Parameters:
      id - of story to find in the project
      command - Command to put on the story

    • deleteUserStoryById

      public void deleteUserStoryById(int id)
      Method searches for a story by ID and then deletes the story. Notably not the index of story in ArrayList, but the ID field associated with it.
      Parameters:
      id - Story id field to find a story by

    • getProjectName

      public String getProjectName()
      Returns project name
      Returns:
      the projectName
